item.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 Fan Gets Their Favorite Horse in Real Life
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Red Dead Redemption 2 player bought a real-life horse resembling their favorite in-game horse, sparking excitement among fans.
  • Horses in RDR2 have unique characteristics and bonding levels affecting gameplay in hunting, combat, and exploration.
  • Fans discuss the game's influence on real life, sharing anecdotes like buying featured horse breeds and mimicking game activities.

A Red Dead Redemption 2 player unlocked a real-life achievement by acquiring their favorite in-game horse for real. Developed by Rockstar Games, Red Dead Redemption 2 is an action-packed adventure game set in the late 1800s American Wild West. It is a prequel to the original Red Dead Redemption , released in 2010, and follows the story of Arthur Morgan, an outlaw and member of the Van der Linde gang.

In Red Dead Redemption 2 , horses play a crucial role beyond transportation. With over 19 different breeds ranging from the sturdy Ardennes to the swift Arabian, each horse possesses unique characteristics that influence its performance, temperament, and suitability for various tasks. Not only that, players can actually bond with their horses. Higher bonding levels unlock new maneuvers and abilities. Horses also aid players in hunting, combat, and exploration. They can carry pelts, carcasses, and other loot, making them indispensable companions for resource gathering and survival. Moreover, horses are essential during intense gunfights and encounters, especially in the multiplayer mode Red Dead Online .

Related
23 Pro Tips For Red Dead Redemption 2 You Should Know
Red Dead Redemption 2 is massive and filled with all sorts of dangers. Use these tips to survive the storyline and more.

On April 24, RDR2 player and Reddit user AmiraJ1 shared a photo of their real-life horse. AmiraJ1 was surprised to realize that their actual horse bears a striking resemblance to the Dappled Buckskin Norfolk Roadster, a horse breed featured in the game. This coincidence sparked a wave of excitement and amusement among fans of the game, who were also surprised at the uncanny resemblance between the two horses.

The post quickly got a lot of interesting comments and reactions from fellow fans on the r/reddeadredemption subreddit. Every fan knows that Red Dead Redemption 2 is extremely detailed , but many of them couldn't even believe the uncanny resemblance between the virtual and real-life horses. Some of them even started joking about the potential real-world manifestation of other game elements.

Real-World Events Reminding People of RDR2

The Reddit post gained a lot of attention within the Red Dead Redemption 2 community, igniting a lively discussion among fans. As players shared their own anecdotes and humorous observations, it became clear that the game's influence extends far beyond the screen, shaping real-life experiences in unexpected ways. Comments like "They made the birds real too?" and "Nonsense, they're government drones" injected humor into the conversation, highlighting the playful camaraderie among gamers. The bond goes beyond the Red Dead Online missions .

One user even said that they pull out a pair of binoculars when they see a bird around them, mimicking the game activity that earns players money and other benefits in the game. Some of them even bought horse breeds that are actually featured in the game because they fell in love with their in-game companions. The community has also seen players recreating Red Dead Redemption 2 scenes in real life . This shows how real life can remind people of their favorite game and vice versa.

item.title: Destiny 2 Fans Are Making Their Guardians Look Like NCR Rangers From Fallout: New Vegas
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Fallout series' resurgence has led to a Destiny 2 player recreating the iconic NCR Ranger armor set using the game's armor customization system.
  • Fallout's popularity spike can be attributed to Amazon's live-action TV series adaptation, which has boosted player engagement and gained the franchise mainstream attention.
  • The Destiny 2 player's detailed NCR Ranger cosplay has been praised by the community, sparking calls for an official Fallout-themed crossover.

Love for the Fallout series has spread into the Last City, as a Destiny 2 player has expertly recreated the look of an iconic Fallout: New Vegas armor set in the game. As with other Destiny 2 "cosplay" looks, the recreation employs the game's armor customization system, turning parts for a Titan Guardian into an NCR Ranger.

Despite having no notable new releases in years, the Fallout series has seen a massive resurgence in popularity over the last few months. Players have been revisiting games in the series, while the online spin-off Fallout 76 broke player participation records five times in six days . The boost is largely due to Amazon's live-action Fallout TV series adaptation, which rekindled many fans' affection for the franchise while bringing the brand major mainstream attention.

2:35
Related
21 Beginner Tips for Fallout 76
Fallout 76 is significantly different from other games in the series, so players will need to take advantage of these tips to succeed in the game.

The attention even extends to games that are theoretically competitors to Fallout , like Destiny 2 , where player whythelongface133 shared a customized Titan armor set designed to emulate the look of a ranger from the Fallout New California Republic faction . Shared on the DestinyFashion Reddit community, whythelongface133 used a number of Titan armor ornaments to come up with a look closely resembling the NCR Ranger uniform, which appears on the cover art for Fallout: New Vegas .

Destiny 2 Player Cosplays In-Game as Fallout: New Vegas NCR Ranger

An elite group of NCR soldiers, the Rangers wear a signature suit of combat armor that incorporates a heavy leather duster and a telltale full-face gas mask and combat helmet. The look is so distinctive that players have imported the NCR Ranger's aesthetic into games like Starfield and beyond .

For their attempt, whythelongface133 centered the look around the iconic gas mask helmet, using the Eidolon Pursuant Helm from Season of the Witch paired with the Erebos Glance shader to color its visor red. The Viperidax Gauntlets from Gambit, Veritas Plate from the Witch Queen expansion, and Crucible Clutch Extol Greaves and Wing Discipline Class Item round out the ensemble. When colored using the Gamekeeper shader, the result resembles a long brown coat worn over an armored breastplate, boots, and well-worn denim pants, in keeping with New Vegas ' western motif.

Players praised whythelongface133's work, commenting with pledges of allegiance to the NCR and jokes referencing Fallout: New Vegas. Others suggested that Bethesda join hands with Bungie to produce a Fallout -themed Destiny 2 crossover and add some official Fallout -themed exotics, such as armor ornaments that evoke iconic Fallout Power Armor suits .

item.title: The Sims 4 Player Unlocks Super Rare Achievement
item.description:
Highlights

  • A player unlocked the rare Legacy Leader achievement in The Sims 4, which challenges players to have 10 households reach 10 generations.
  • Achievements in The Sims 4 are badges of honor, steering players towards goals and reflecting time spent in-game.

A fan of The Sims 4 has unlocked a super rare achievement in the game, called Legacy Leader. It's an achievement that ties into the number of households and generations in the world, and even more experienced The Sims 4 players report not knowing of its existence.

Achievements in The Sims 4 are a way to steer players towards achieving goals with their Sims and are a badge of honor upon completion, denoting time spent in-game. Whether it's reaching the highest levels in a chosen profession, or earning the most money in The Sims 4 . With how in-depth the achievements go, it's no wonder that many go unnoticed by the average Simmer. The rare one discovered today, however, has even the experienced Simmers stumped.

Related
19 Fun Build Challenges In The Sims 4
If building has become monotonous in The Sims 4, why not try these fun challenges to help spice things up a bit?

A Reddit user by the username thetiniestlifeboat revealed that they've managed to unlock the Legacy Leader achievement, which is awarded to players that have ten households in the world that have been played for ten generations or more. It's an achievement that takes a lot of dedication to accomplish, as reaching ten generations with one family, much less ten of them, requires a lot of time invested due to the average lifespan of a Sim in The Sims 4 .

Some players have pointed out that there is an achievement that delves into this aspect of gameplay even further. It's called the Alphabet Legacy and is achieved once players hit the 26th generation. This is something that would require quite the processing power, unless players use some of The Sims 4 's mods to clean up their ghosts and help their hardware out. And even then, all that effort can still go to waste should an unexpected death occur.

The Sims 4 Players Try Out New Content Rather Than Focusing on One Family

This is why many players noted how bored they have become of their family by the third generation, and just go on to create a new one from scratch. After all, there is a plethora of content to try out, whether it's new The Sims 4 content added by Maxis , or self-imposed challenges that can vary from the mundane life of farming to setting up a lair of familial vampires.

As a cozy game, Simmers usually prefer to get up to shenanigans like having a dead Sim send condolences to themselves, rather than stick with one family for generations. On the other hand, the information about the existence of such a rare achievement, as many Simmers comment, is just the impetus they needed for the final push.

item.title: Fallout 4 intro Goes Horribly Wrong For Unlucky NPC
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Fallout 4 player experienced a funny glitch where an NPC gets left behind during the pre-war introductory sequence, dooming them to death by nuclear explosion.
  • The Fallout franchise has been gaining popularity thanks to Amazon's TV show, sparking interest in its retro-futuristic world among fans old and new.
  • Despite technical issues, fans still rush to play Fallout 4, showcasing continued hype and excitement for the beloved franchise.

A Fallout 4 fan discovered a silly glitch involving an NPC meeting a rather untimely fate while playing through the game's pre-war introductory sequence. The popular Bethesda RPG is somewhat infamous for being fairly buggy like most of the developer's other games, and although these bugs can be occasionally infuriating, some of them can be pretty funny. The glitch that this particular Fallout 4 player experienced is definitely more so on the humorous side rather than the game-breaking one, and it's quite the sight to behold.

Thanks to the immense success of Amazon's Fallout TV show, the Fallout franchise as a whole has been rising in popularity lately. With the live-action adaptation capturing the attention of mainstream audiences around the globe, many gamers have been flocking to the Fallout games to get an extra whiff of the distinct, retro-futuristic world that only this post-apocalyptic series can provide. The fourth mainline installment of Bethesda's beloved franchise, in particular, has been experiencing the best of this resurgence, with Fallout 4 recently topping European sales charts almost nine years after its original release. Of course, with this increased popularity comes more fans, and with more fans comes more funny discoveries, namely when it comes to bugs and glitches. One of the latest of these discoveries to be shared on social media, though, is especially comical, to say the least.

Related
Fallout 4 Player Creates Accurate Lucy from the TV Series in the Game
A talented gamer manages to recreate Lucy MacLean from the Fallout TV series in Fallout 4, in one of the most accurate portrayals so far.

On the r/Fallout subreddit, Reddit user RubberChicken36 shared a brief clip of a nuclear bomb dropping during one of the cutscenes from the pre-war opening segment of Fallout 4 . In the short video, the player character, his wife, and some NPCs are seen riding an elevator down to Vault 111 as they narrowly escape the massive shockwaves from the earth-shattering explosion. Unfortunately, though, Fallout 4 glitches out , and one of the NPCs that's supposed to be heading down the elevator alongside the player gets stuck outside instead. The doors below the character close almost immediately afterward, making her as good as dead.

As goofy of a glitch as this is, this is by no means the only strange bug that players have recently found in Bethesda's hit RPG. One Fallout 4 player, for instance, found a hilarious glitch in which an NPC was somehow swimming through the streets of the Commonwealth. Meanwhile, another gamer stumbled upon a bug that turned the popular synth companion Nick Valentine into a Jet addict for some reason. Though bugs and glitches typically hamper the quality of a game's experience, sometimes bizarre glitches like these can make playing titles like Fallout 4 a little bit more entertaining.

Fans Have Found No Shortage of Funny Bugs and Glitches in Fallout 4

It's not all good news when it comes to Fallout , though, as the recently-released next-gen update for Fallout 4 has been widely criticized by fans for launching with several technical issues, despite having been delayed for over a year. Nonetheless, many gamers are still rushing to play Fallout 4 , which goes to show just how much hype and excitement is surrounding the franchise at the moment.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Player Notices Interesting Detail in Widowmaker's Mirrorwatch Skin
item.description:
Highlights

  • One of Overwatch 2's Mirrorwatch skins has a clever detail, with Widowmaker's sporting a cybernetic eye.
  • Mirrorwatch swaps the roles of heroes, creating a universe where Overwatch agents become Talon operatives and vice versa.
  • Overwatch 2's lore is reflected in Widowmaker's Mirrorwatch skin, referencing the cybernetic eye Ana lost in her clash with Widowmaker.

An Overwatch 2 player noticed an interesting detail in Widowmaker's Mirrorwatch skin, which has a different-colored cybernetic eye. Overwatch 2 kicked off Season 10 this month and brought a wide range of changes for players. Blizzard's shooter also added new content, with Overwatch 2 hosting one of this year's most talked-about events.

Mirrorwatch is underway and has caught players' eyes by creating an alternative universe that swaps the roles of Overwatch 2 's heroes. Overwatch agents have become Talon operatives, with Talon members following the reverse path. To accompany the change in the heroes' origins, Overwatch 2 released skins with the characters' new looks, including Mercy's new Mythic skin that gave the support hero a very different appearance from her original. Confirming how intriguing Mirrorwatch is, an Overwatch 2 player found a clever detail related to the event.

Related
Overwatch 2: 9 Best Widowmaker Skins, Ranked
Overwatch 2's Widowmaker has some of the best skins in Blizzard's game, but which ones really suit the assassin?

Reddit user t0mless noticed that Widowmaker has a cybernetic eye on her Mirrorwatch skin. The player shared two close-up images of the Death Stare intro, where players can see that Widowmaker's right eye has a yellowish tone, unlike the character's left eye, which is blue. Mirrorwatch attracted the attention of Overwatch 2 players because of the premise, allowing fans to see Widowmaker on the good guys' side along with Sombra and Doomfist. Named Captain Lacroix, Widowmaker's new outfit hides more than Overwatch 2 players can imagine.

Widowmaker's Mirrorwatch Skin Makes Clever Reference to Overwatch 2 Lore

Overwatch 2 has included a smart reference to its lore in the Widowmaker skin, which is the Mirrorwatch equivalent of Ana. One of the founding members of Overwatch, Ana was known for being an excellent sniper thanks to her cybernetic right eye. Everything changed, however, in a tumultuous encounter between Widowmaker and Ana , with Widow destroying Ana's cybernetic eye. Instead of repairing the prosthesis, Ana decides to wear an eye patch as a reminder of who she has become after the clash with Widowmaker. She also changes her approach to work and starts to avoid taking lives when possible.

Because of its variety of heroes, Overwatch 2 has remarkably rich lore, and this subtle but neat Easter egg in Widowmaker's Mirrorwatch skin is proof. For players who haven't joined the event yet, Mirrorwatch ends on May 13. Most of the Mirrorwatch skins can be acquired through the Overwatch 2 Season 10 Battle Pass , with players getting the Widowmaker Mirrorwatch skin by reaching Tier 80 of the Premium Battle Pass.
